```{r, include = FALSE}
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"

library(g3r)
library(htmltools)
```

Works as an htmlwidget simply call the `g3r` function.

```{r}
library(g3r)

# grand canyon
g3r(lat = 36.2058, lon = -112.4413, alpha = TRUE) %>% g3r_camera(.5,.5,1)
```

You can run a demo with:

```r
g3r::g3r_demo()
```

## Points

You can add points to map with `g3r_points`, below we plot a town near the Swiss peak of Jungfrau.

```{r}
df <- data.frame(
  lon =  7.9610, 
  lat = 46.5852,
  ele = 2100
)

g3r(46.5763, 7.9904) %>% 
  g3r_points(df, lat, lon, ele) 
```
